title: Re-scrutinized results of 2025 Scholarship Exam released
byline: The re-scrutinized results of the 2025 Grade 5 Scholarship Examination, have been released online, according to the Department of Examinations.

title: Pakistan, Afghanistan agree to ceasefire after days of deadly clashes
byline: Afghanistan and Pakistan have agreed to an immediate ceasefire, Qatar’s Foreign Ministry said Sunday. It follows more than a week of fighting that has killed dozens of people and injured hundreds.

title: Few showers expected in parts of the island today
byline: Showers or thundershowers will occur at most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m, today (19), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Sri Lanka launches GIS-based rubber land mapping program
byline: The Rubber Development Department and the Survey Department of Sri Lanka have jointly initiated a rubber land mapping program utilizing innovative Geographic Information System (GIS) technology.

title: PM Harini returns after concluding visit to India
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has returned to Sri Lanka after completing an official diplomatic visit to India.

title: Sri Lanka reports 35 malaria cases so far this year
byline: The Anti Malaria Campaign has reported that a total of 35 malaria cases have been identified in Sri Lanka so far this year, with one fatality recorded.

title: 30-hour water cut in several areas of Galle District
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced that a 30-hour water cut will be implemented in several areas of the Galle District tomorrow (20).

title: Matugama woman who sheltered Ishara Sewwandi remanded
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the remand of a woman from Matugama who had been arrested for allegedly providing accommodation to Ishara Sewwandi, until October 24.

title: 50 bullets found following interrogation of ‘Gampaha Baba’
byline: According to information obtained from a suspect known as ‘Gampaha Baba’, a member of an organized criminal gang who was recently arrested in Nepal and brought to the island, 50 rounds of T-56 ammunition have been recovered.

title: ICTA provides update on Lanka Government Cloud service disruptions
byline: The Information and Communication Technology Agency (ICTA) of Sri Lanka has issued an update on the ongoing partial disruption affecting the Lanka Government Cloud (LGC) services, as outlined in its initial media release.

title: National Deepavali festival held in Hatton
byline: The National Deepavali Festival was held at the Sri Manikka Pillayar Kovil in Hatton this morning, in view of the Deepavali festival which falls tomorrow.

title: World-famous Louvre museum in Paris closed after robbery
byline: The Louvre museum in Paris has been closed following a robbery, according to France’s culture minister.

title: Cardinal Malcolm Ranjith stresses the importance of spiritual development
byline: Archbishop of Colombo His Eminence Malcolm Cardinal Ranjith has emphasised that people must undergo spiritual development, calling on everyone to commit themselves to living in accordance with religious teachings.

title: Foreign national arrested for cultivating ‘Kush’ cannabis in rented house in Akmeemana
byline: A Belarusian national has been apprehended for cultivating ‘Kush’ cannabis in a rented house in Akmeemana, police stated.

title: Twelve including nine children injured in Ragama bus accident
byline: Twelve individuals, including nine children, have been injured in a bus accident reported in Batuwatta, Ragama.

title: Limp Bizkit bassist Sam Rivers dies aged 48
byline: Sam Rivers, the bassist and founding member of US nu metal band Limp Bizkit, has died at the age of 48.

title: Landslide warnings issued for seven districts extended
byline: Landslide warnings issued to residents of seven districts owing to incessant rains experienced in parts of the island have been extended.

title: Sri Lanka’s Yevan David wins Rookie Trophy, places 2nd overall in 2025 Euroformula Open
byline: Sri Lanka’s Yevan David on Sunday re-wrote history by winning the Rookie Championship title and second place overall in the 2025 Euroformula Open Championship, becoming the first Sri Lankan racer to achieve both.

title: Two night mail trains cancelled due to derailment near Ihalakotte
byline: Two night mail trains scheduled to operate today (19) have been cancelled, Sri Lanka Railways has announced.

title: Bangladesh probes cause of massive airport fire
byline: Bangladeshi traders on Sunday (Oct 19) assessed heavy losses after a devastating fire tore through the cargo complex of the country’s main international airport, as the government opened an investigation into possible arson.

title: Train derailment disrupts services along the Main Line
byline: Rail operations along the Upcountry Railway Line have been disrupted due to a derailment, according to the Department of Railways.

title: RDA to install 50 km of safety fences on high-risk mountain roads
byline: The Road Development Authority (RDA) will install safety barriers along hazardous embankments in three mountainous regions following a recent spike in road accidents, a senior official said.

title: Increase in rainfall expected after Tuesday: Met. Department
byline: Rainfall is expected to increase after Tuesday (21), the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Ex-French president Nicolas Sarkozy to start five-year prison sentence on Tuesday
byline: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy, set to start a five-year prison sentence on Tuesday after being convicted of attempting to raise campaign funds from Libya in 2007, said he is not afraid of going to jail, La Tribune Dimanche reported.

title: Local and foreign tourists stranded in Wilpattu National Park rescued by wildlife officers
byline: More than 30 local and foreign tourists who were visiting the Wilpattu National Park have been rescued by wildlife officers after being unable to return due to heavy rainfall and flooding.

title: Israel strikes southern Gaza, accusing Hamas of ‘bold violation of ceasefire’
byline: The Israeli army launched airstrikes in Rafah in the southern Gaza Strip on Sunday despite a ceasefire agreement with Hamas, local media said.

title: Another train derailment disrupts operations on Kelani Valley Line
byline: Train services along the Kelani Valley railway line have been affected by a derailment.

title: Ishara Sewwandi taken to Kilinochchi as part of Ganemulla Sanjeewa murder probe
byline: Ishara Sewwandi, who is in the custody of the Colombo Crime Division in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, also known as ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa’, has been taken to Kilinochchi.

title: New curricula for Grades 1 and 6 to be released soon – Education Ministry
byline: The Ministry of Education has announced that the new curricula for Grades 1 and 6, under the upcoming education reforms, will be released soon.

title: Mass shooting at US University injures three, “No ongoing threat,” say police
byline: A shooting at an Oklahoma State University residence hall wounded at least three people early Sunday morning, according to a university spokesperson.

title: Several train journeys cancelled due to derailment near Ihalakotte
byline: The Railway Department has announced that several train journeys along the upcountry railway line will be cancelled tomorrow (20), due to a derailment near the Ihalakotte railway station today (19).
